data.text:
Sir Charles Hotham, 5th Bt.1

M, #564551, d. 15 January 1738/39

Last Edited=17 May 2015

Sir Charles Hotham, 5th Bt. was the son of Sir Charles Hotham, 4th Bt. and Bridget Gee.1 He married Lady Gertrude Stanhope, daughter of Philip Stanhope, 3rd Earl of Chesterfield and Lady Elizabeth Saville, in 1724.1 He died on 15 January 1738/39.1

He was Groom of the Bedchamber.1 He succeeded as the 5th Baronet Hotham [E., 1622] in January 1722/23.1 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) for Beverley.1 He gained the rank of Colonel of Horse in the Grenadier Guards.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 1974. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

[S37] BP2003. [S37]

Sir Charles Hotham, 6th Bt.1

M, #564552, d. 1767

Last Edited=5 Aug 2012

Sir Charles Hotham, 6th Bt. was the son of Sir Charles Hotham, 5th Bt. and Lady Gertrude Stanhope.1 He married Caroline Anne Clutterbuck, daughter of Thomas Clutterbuck.1 He died in 1767, without issue.1

He was Groom of the Bedchamber.1 He succeeded as the 6th Baronet Hotham [E., 1622] on 15 January 1738/39.1

Citations

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 1974. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Sir Thomas Norcliffe1

M, #564554, b. 21 September 1578

Last Edited=6 Feb 2018

Sir Thomas Norcliffe was born on 21 September 1578.2 He was the son of Thomas Norcliffe and Elizabeth Eland.2 He married Catharine Bamburgh, daughter of Sir William Bamburgh, 1st Bt. and Mary Foard.1

Caroline Anne Clutterbuck1

F, #564556, d. 1759

Last Edited=29 Jul 2012

Caroline Anne Clutterbuck was the daughter of Thomas Clutterbuck.1 She married Sir Charles Hotham, 6th Bt., son of Sir Charles Hotham, 5th Bt. and Lady Gertrude Stanhope.1 She died in 1759.1

Her married name became Hotham.1

George Hudlestone Powell1

M, #564559, b. 24 February 1849

Last Edited=9 Dec 2013

George Hudlestone Powell was born on 24 February 1849.1 He was the son of Eyre Burton Powell and Elizabeth Hamilton Matilda de Jourions Langley.1 He was baptised on 6 April 1849 at Egmore, Madras, India.1
